Envelheceu muito bem este jogo, demorei algum tempo para me acostumar com a movimentação e com o conceito de inimigos não pararem de atirar até estarem mortos, evitei fazer salvos demais e posso dizer com certeza que foram 15 horas muito bem gastas. 

Como eu tenho o hábito de jogar os jogos apenas 10 ou 20 anos depois que foram lançados, daqui esse tempo jogarei a versão VR de half life e acharei excelente.

The goat of all games. Do yourself a favor and try it out, you won't regret it.
There are even tons of mods to make the game look more HD, if you can't stand the old school graphics.

I can’t help but feel I’m missing out on something because every single positive review seems to be talking about a completely different game than the one I played. I should specify this is a review of the first 3 hours of the game (I couldn’t bear it any further) from someone who is completely new to the series, unconcerned with its legacy. 

The graphics and overall presentation hold up fine. They would obviously be considered dated by today’s standards but they’re pleasant, if unremarkable, and don’t break immersion.

The issue with Half-life is... well... everything else. 

The level design is shockingly bad from both an aesthetic and functional perspective. The muted greys of the facility are repetitive and boring and the game somehow fails to make a secret underground nuclear(?) military research base novel in any way. If vents turn you on you’ll be hard as diamonds by the end of this game because the sheer amount of them is staggering. There are puzzles I suppose (I stacked a crate!) but the strongest puzzle is ultimately going to be finding a reason to continue playing. Few if any of the puzzles are engaging or challenging and feel more akin to busywork. 

The layout is twisting and bizarre to the point of having nothing in common with any real life building whatsoever. Its so shockingly so that it constantly breaks immersion and provides no sense of progression. It feels as if the player is merely tossed around different parts of some massive sprawling purgatorial corridor, never gaining a sense of whether they’re closer or not to the end goal (escape?).

Of course this would not be a complete non-issue if the shooting was the focus and the setting was just an excuse to get the to meat of the game (e.g. mario 64). However that’s not the case- clever storytelling through gameplay and environment are often touted as a major draw of the half life series. There are certainly instances of this - learning the military is in fact not there to help as you watch scientists gunned down from above, or seeing some poor soul dragged into a vent in the distance, foreshadowing the arrival of (yet more) headcrabs. But these instances are here and there and aren’t interconnected in any interesting way. 

Furthermore the actual meat of the game (Puzzle solving, FPS gameplay) is… passable at beast. The shooting is OK. I didn’t expect much and it delivered wholesale on that expectation. The guns are generic dollar store military weapons and feel underwhelming to shoot.

There’s very little in the way of mechanics or movement to learn, and the dominant strategy ultimately comes down to simply running past most enemies (the most pleasant way to play the game on hard). On the rare occasion however, the game flips the script and you’re stuck between hordes of vortigaunt and the exit hoping you don’t get insta force-lightninged to death while you wield the worst shotgun known to gaming history. Obviously this is 1998 so I’m not expecting current day AAA levels of feedback and tuning in the gunplay, but compared to something like Doom or even Marathon Half Life’s gunplay can’t hold a candle and feels phoned in.

The movement is clunky and has some weird kind of inertia to it. This wouldn’t be a problem in your average FPS but the game is filled with an outrageous amount of platforming over instant death pits (Sometimes several in a row) meaning you’ll be restarting at the same checkpoint over and over unless you’re save scumming s.t.a.l.k.e.r. style. Another weird design choice in this vein is crouch jumping. It’s unclear to me why crouch jumping is so heavily implemented in the game. It feels janky and adds nothing whatsoever. Why not just let Freeman jump higher? 

The ladders make me want to blow my brains out. 

I can’t say whether the story picks up later or not but the beginning has nothing to offer. The silent protagonist is a theoretical physicist who works with highly dangerous alien materials. This seems novel, and a welcome change from the characters that seem typical for the genre. But nope. Half life is just an cool man who kills aliens and doesn’t afraid of anything. 

On hard the difficulty is inconsistent, ranging between easy (most segments with the soldiers) to extremely punishing (office with the vortigaunts), and the game rarely finds a way to slowly build up difficulty or create a skill curve. 

There are some novelties in this game, and those occur when the puzzles mesh with the combat, like leading superior numbers of enemies past a room filled with turrets while you dash behind the boxes to avoid getting shot. This is good fun and I imagine this is what made the game a hit, but for every one of these moments there’s another level segment filled with god awful platforming, crate stacking, and vents. 

I’d give it a 2/5 at best. There were things to like about it and it’s clear the game was hugely influential but poor design choices and underwhelming FPS gameplay middle this title and prevent it from holding up alongside other FPS classics.

I've glitched the game many times, getting stuck and needing to load an old save twice in the first 30 minutes. There are also some spots that dont refresh, and i got out of bounds. It's an amazing game however, a classic. I know this review may seem negative but those occasional bugs are not enough to make this game any less than amazing.

Where it all improved... Advanced AI, innovative HUD, engaging story, no cutscenes, gory gibs, large maps, advanced physics engine, damn good horror, cool creature design, silent protagonist and lots of crowbarring action. Half-Life 3's memic reputation and legendary status as the game to break all games is built on this game's legacy and status as a prime first-person shooter for the PC. Please Valve, learn to count to three (3).

It wasn't all too long, and was fun almost the entire way through.
The final boss was surprisingly easy, almost disappointingly so.
Spoiler warning after this point.
I'm assuming the final boss was so easy because as soon as I was getting less assault ammo, I started using something else to conserve it. Went into the boss armed to the teeth. After only a few deaths, I found that the fight was zap the crystals, then throw all the ammo I have into him while super-long-jumping around to avoid the one real attack he has. Duck behind pillars to avoid getting teleported, and the fight shouldn't take too long.

Half-Life is a classic game and a must play.  The game has aged alot and now feels odly nostalgic and charming with its low textures and weird sound effects, but it is surprisingly well optimized and is still very fun to play. I have never experienced a game that has aged so well and gracefully.  The game still runs quite fluently, I have encountered no technical issues or bugs.

Um clássico obrigatório na sua biblioteca Steam, desde os tempos das Lan Houses tirando altos PVP's no mapa Crossfire, onde sempre um filho de uma mãe querida apertava o maldito botão da explosão e todo mundo saia louco pra chegar no bunker o mais rápido antes de todo mundo morrer. Falhar miseravelmente e morrer no caminho, pois outro filho de uma mãe querida estar controlando um dos canhões nas torres. A campanha do jogo é sensacional uma história incrível. Será que o 3 vai realmente sair algum dia? Gráficos antigos que da pra rodar em qualquer calculadora CASIO, acho que o pai dos FPS de hoje. Resumindo é um jogo maravilhoso.
I can probably imagine a full playthrough of this legendary game in my sleep.
old but fun

Sinceramente, nunca creí jugar a un Half-Life en mi vida, sin embargo, me arrepiento de totalmente de no haberlo hecho previamente. Que juegazo tan bárbaro, tienes que prestar atención a todo detalle y el modo en el que se desarrolla es algo que sinceramente no había visto en ningún otro juego anteriormente. Resumiendo... Compralo, no te arrepentirás.

Начало игр серии Half-Life. Несмотря что игра вышла в 1998 году, игра остаётся атмосферной и очень интересной. Графика, отсутствие кат-сцен, сюжет и многое другое в те времена считалось нечто невероятным. Короче, всем советую приобрести эту игру и поиграть, не пожалеете ;)

Timeless masterpiece. The gameplay and graphics still holds up incredibly well to today and I enjoyed it like the first time. 

However, I came across a couple of glitches (like one where I kept being stuck inside a pipe after a loading screen or another related to the boss Gonarch) which I can't recall if they were in the original version but I wish they had fixed these for the Steam version.

Легендарные игры этой серии , 
Япрохожу  уже какой раз ...
Эти игры сделаны с любовью ,
Для людей от людей ,
Ты не поймешь всю суть этой игры ,
Пока сам не пройдешь её ,
Эту игру потянет любой комп ,
Ведь она не требоватьльна к нему...
О моя халф лайф , люблю тебя я очень сильно ,
Надеюсь ты тоже это поймешь,
Советую купить её тебе скорее , 
Надеюсь помогло , тебе моё стихотворение...
